Less typing constructors:

Types

Color = object
  r*: float32                ## red (0-1)
  g*: float32                ## green (0-1)
  b*: float32                ## blue (0-1)
  a*: float32                ## alpha (0-1, 0 is fully transparent)
Main color type, float32 points 
ColorCMY = object
  c*: float32                ## Cyan 0 to 100
  m*: float32                ## Magenta 0 to 100
  y*: float32                ## Yellow 0 to 100
CMY colors are reverse of rgb and as 100% 
ColorCMYK = object
  c*: float32                ## Cyan 0 to 1
  m*: float32                ## Magenta 0 to 1
  y*: float32                ## Yellow 0 to 1
  k*: float32                ## Black 0 to 1
CMYK colors are used in printing 
ColorHCL = ColorPolarLUV
ColorHSL = object
  h*: float32                ## hue 0 to 360
  s*: float32                ## saturation 0 to 100
  l*: float32                ## lightness 0 to 100
HSL attempts to resemble more perceptual color models 
ColorHSV = object
  h*: float32                ## hue 0 to 360
  s*: float32                ## saturation 0 to 100
  v*: float32                ## value 0 to 100
HSV models the way paints of different colors mix together 
ColorLAB = object
  l*: float32                ## lightness, range 0.0 (black) to 100.0 (white)
  a*: float32                ## green (min) to red (max)
  b*: float32                ## blue (min) to yellow (max)
  
ColorLUV = object
  l*: float32                ## lightness, range 0.0 to 100.0
  u*: float32                ## red to green
  v*: float32                ## blue to yellow
  
ColorOklab = object
  L*: float32                ## perceived lightness
  a*: float32                ## greenless/redness
  b*: float32                ## blueless/yellowless
  
ColorPolarLAB = object
  l*: float32                ## lightness, range 0.0 (black) to 100.0 (white)
  c*: float32                ## chroma, range 0.0 to max
  h*: float32                ## hue angle, range 0.0 to 360.0
                             ## (red: 0, yellow: 90, green: 180, blue: 270)
  
ColorPolarLUV = object
  h*: float32                ## hue angle, range 0.0 to 360.0
  c*: float32                ## chroma
  l*: float32                ## luminance
  
ColorPolarOklab = object
  L*: float32                ## perceived lightness
  C*: float32                ## chroma
  h*: float32                ## hue
  
ColorRGB = object
  r*: uint8                  ## Red 0-255
  g*: uint8                  ## Green 0-255
  b*: uint8                  ## Blue 0-255
Color stored as 3 uint8s 
ColorRGBA = object
  r*: uint8                  ## Red 0-255
  g*: uint8                  ## Green 0-255
  b*: uint8                  ## Blue 0-255
  a*: uint8                  ## Alpha 0-255
Color stored as 4 uint8s 
ColorRGBX = object
  r*: uint8                  ## Red 0-a
  g*: uint8                  ## Green 0-a
  b*: uint8                  ## Blue 0-a
  a*: uint8                  ## Alpha 0-255
Premultiplied alpha RGBA color stored as 4 uint8s 
ColorXYZ = object
  x*: float32                ## range 0.0 to WhiteX
  y*: float32                ## range 0.0 to WhiteY
  z*: float32                ## range 0.0 to WhiteZ
  
ColorYUV = object
  y*: float32                ## 0 to 1
  u*: float32                ## -0.5 to 0.5
  v*: float32                ## -0.5 to 0.5
YUV originally a television color format, still used in digital movies 
InvalidColor = object of ValueError
SomeColor = Color | ColorRGB | ColorRGBA | ColorHSL | ColorHSV | ColorCMY |
    ColorCMYK |
    ColorYUV |
    ColorLAB |
    ColorPolarLAB |
    ColorLUV |
    ColorPolarLUV |
    ColorXYZ |
    ColorOklab |
    ColorPolarOklab |
    ColorRGBX

Procs

proc cmy(c, m, y: float32): ColorCMY {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
proc cmyk(c, m, y, k: float32): ColorCMYK {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
proc color(r, g, b: float32; a: float32 = 1.0): Color {.inline, ...raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Creates from floats like:
  • color(1,0,0) -> red
  • color(0,1,0) -> green
  • color(0,0,1) -> blue
  • color(0,0,0,1) -> opaque black
  • color(0,0,0,0) -> transparent black
proc hsl(h, s, l: float32): ColorHSL {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
proc hsv(h, s, v: float32): ColorHSV {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
proc lab(l, a, b: float32): ColorLAB {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
proc luv(l, u, v: float32): ColorLUV {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
proc oklab(L, a, b: float32): ColorOklab {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
proc polarLAB(l, c, h: float32): ColorPolarLAB {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
proc polarLUV(h, c, l: float32): ColorPolarLUV {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
proc polarOklab(L, C, h: float32): ColorPolarOklab {.inline, ...raises: [],
    tags: [].}
proc rgb(r, g, b: uint8): ColorRGB {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Creates from uint8s like:
  • rgba(255,0,0) -> red
  • rgba(0,255,0) -> green
  • rgba(0,0,255) -> blue
proc rgba(r, g, b, a: uint8): ColorRGBA {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Creates from uint8s like:
  • rgba(255,0,0,255) -> red
  • rgba(0,255,0,255) -> green
  • rgba(0,0,255,255) -> blue
  • rgba(0,0,0,255) -> opaque black
  • rgba(0,0,0,0) -> transparent black
proc rgbx(r, g, b, a: uint8): ColorRGBX {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Creates from uint8s like:
  • rgbx(255,0,0,255) -> red
  • rgbx(0,255,0,255) -> green
  • rgbx(0,0,255,255) -> blue
  • rgbx(0,0,0,255) -> opaque black
  • rgbx(0,0,0,0) -> transparent black
proc xyz(x, y, z: float32): ColorXYZ {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
proc yuv(y, u, v: float32): ColorYUV {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
